author: slive
msg: We really don't want .gz or .Z to be encoded, because
browsers will decode without changing the filename,
causing confusion.  But then we need to make sure the
content-type is not just tar because:
- This is not true.  It is a compressed tar file.
- Some browsers (MSIE) will change the extension
to match the file type, resulting in .tar.tar.
Note this change should carry over to mirrors and
have the added benefit of making .gz.asc files
readable (although we would prefer that people obtain
these from apache.org anyway).
